result.execSummary:
The defendant Amy Rose Crowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality-"Repeater"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: any other sentence
Concurrent with: sentence in 16CF31

superMiscConds.notes: Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..WITH THE EXCEPTION OF PHARMACIES.
  The Def is to take all medications as prescribed by treating physician and only in the manner & dosage as prescribed!
NO CONTACT WITH R.F.
NO ABUSIVE CONTACT WITH B.S.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.

Complete individual counseling or group counseling that addresses issues surraounding domestic violence and prevention 
  Def is to obtain anger management counseling and to complete recommended treatment;  with the Def finding the funding for such counseling.
  The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.

supervisions.notes:
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
Consecutive to: any other sentence
Concurrent with: to case 16CF31

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amy Rose Crowe

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Amy Rose Crowe in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement (see attached).  Parties state this is the agreement.  Def pleads N/C to all charges. Admits acts of domest abuse in case 16cf31, admits repeater. 16CF31 cts 1 and 4 DRI. Ct accepts pleas finds def Guilty. State has complied with victim rights (no response). All financial obligations paid through DOC. Not eligable for Challenge or Substance abuse progam. No gun No vote.
Notice of right to seek postconviction relief

Defendant Amy Rose Crowe appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Kelly J Mcknight appeared for State of Wisconsin.  J Hoffmann appears for today only.  Rec'd copy compl; waives read.  Stand mute in 16 CM 31 - req speedy trial in CM case & JT sched'd.  Waives t l for p h in 16 CF 31 case, sets PH 2/24/16 @ 3:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.
